== Who I am ==

My name is Andrei Gherzan, and I have been a member of the Ubuntu Kernel Team since January 2023.

I hold a master's degree in Software Development and Technology (Advanced Computing) from the IT University of Copenhagen.

I was fortunate to live in the open-source world for over a decade while always being involved in Linux-based projects. During this journey, I played various roles in big (e.g., Windriver)  and small (e.g., Balena) companies, from contributor to software lead and architect.

== My Ubuntu story ==

I started my Linux-based distro "daily driver" journey back in 2006 with Ubuntu Dapper Drake. I have only lingered a few years on it as Fedora, ArchLinux, CentOS, openSUSE, and other derivatives tempted me on the way. I thought my journey had finally become boring while sticking to Arch Linux for around seven years, but 2023 was when I went full circle with Ubuntu Jammy Jellyfish. Not only that, but I've done it while also joining the Ubuntu Kernel Team.

I admit it is a mixed bag because I like a Jammy doughnut, but I'm not keen on seeing a Jellyfish swimming next to me [J].

=== My involvement ===

I have been involved in the SRU (StableReleaseUpdates) process of releasing various Ubuntu kernel packages for a while, driving the release of kernels of different typesâ€”for example, Snapdragon, KVM, AWS, HWE, etc. These activities included debugging and fixing various regression tests during the release process. While doing so, I contributed upstream fixes to the Linux kernel and other non-kernel packages - for example, LXC, DKMS packages, uvtool, etc. Some of these included being part of their respective SRU process.

I'm requesting upload rights for the kernel package set for all active series, which includes all the "linux*" packages.

=== Kleber Souza ===

==== General feedback ====
I have reviewed some of the kernels cranked by Andrei and found no major issues with them. Andrei is attentive to details, reacts quickly when feedback is given and has a great technical background. He has also been proactive and solved several issues on other packages that gravitate around the kernels. I'm completely confident that Andrei will continue to prepare kernels with care and will look for help when in doubt. Therefore I'm +1 for granting Andrei upload rights for all kernel packages.

==== Specific Experiences of working together ====
I have been working closely with Andrei since he joined the Canonical Kernel Team and he has demonstrated to be a quick learner and always takes initiative to solve problems.

==== Areas of Improvement ====
Nothing to mention so far.

=== Stefan Bader (smb) ===

==== General Feedback ====

I did some of the reviews for Andrei and do not remember having
any bigger complaint. From other tasks observed (hinting for
ADT or RT or fixing tests) it also looks like those are done with
a good deal of care and keeping an eye on details. And if something
is not clear Andrei is not hesitating to reach out to other people.
All in all I trust Andrei to use his PPU rights carefully and thus
am recommeding to approve his application.

==== Suggestions for Improvement ====

I have not specific suggestion, just my favourite thing of pointing
out that preparing an upload, always look at the new changelog and
think about how much sense this would make to oneself as a user.
This is particularly for the main kernel package but also any other
package where the users will have an option to look at the changes
contained in the *_source.changes file. And we all hate to see
"fixes and improvements" in there.
